ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: To what degree did you develop a helping alliance with the adolescent?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little bit; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = To a good extent; 5 = To a great extent

ElementDescription: To what extent did you obtain a mental health service use history (of adolescent and/or family)?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little bit; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = To a good extent; 5 = To a great extent

ElementDescription: To what degree did you clarify the presenting problem with the adolescent?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little bit; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = To a good extent; 5 = To a great extent

ElementDescription: To what degree did you clarify the presenting problem with the caregiver?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little bit; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = To a good extent; 5 = To a great extent

ElementDescription: To what extent did you determine the level of engagement with the adolescent?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little bit; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = To a good extent; 5 = To a great extent

ElementDescription: To what extent did you determine the level of engagement with the caregiver?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little bit; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = To a good extent; 5 = To a great extent

ElementDescription: To what extent did you determine the perceived relevance of treatment with the adolescent?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little bit; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = To a good extent; 5 = To a great extent

ElementDescription: To what extent did you determine the perceived relevance of treatment with the caregiver?
Notes: 1 = Not at all; 2 = A little bit; 3 = Somewhat; 4 = To a good extent; 5 = To a great extent

ElementDescription: Assessed the stage of change to:
Notes: 1 = Precontemplation; 2 = Contemplation; 3 = Preparation; 4 = Action; 5 = Maintenance; 5 = Relapse

ElementDescription: Barriers addressed: Adolescent-caregiver consensus regarding need for treatment?
Barriers addressed: Developmental/cultural-related (e.g., peer influences, network influences, stigma, religious beliefs)?
Barriers addressed: Other?
If you chose Other for barriers addressed, please specify
Did you complete the role plays with the adolescent or caregiver?
If you did complete the role plays with the adolescent or caregiver, what was the focus of the role play?
If you did not complete the role plays with the adolescent or caregiver, was there a reason why the role play was not completed?
If the role play was completed, was it effective?
Please explain if the role play was effective or not
Please explain if an additional MCI session is necessary or not necessary
